Trump Executive Order
If Maryland fails to comply with the Order, it could face serious financial repercussions. Non-compliance may result in the loss of up to $3.2 million in federal funding. At stake is not just money, but public trust in the integrity of Maryland’s elections.
Discover more
Election Board Accountability
How to keep your Election Board Accountable? As stewards of our democratic process, Election Boards have a duty to uphold transparency and compliance. At stake is the public trust in Maryland’s elections.
Discover more
List Maintenance
A Maryland Data Research Report, included a review of 1400 deceased individuals listed on the official Voter Registration Database in August 2024. Why this is important?
Discover more

Statement of Purpose

Secure the Vote Maryland aims to restore faith in Maryland Elections through voter accuracy.
We are a team of dedicated Maryland citizens who have organized various efforts to verify voter
validity and ensure the integrity of our official Maryland voter database.

The Mission of Secure the Vote Maryland

Secure the Vote Maryland is dedicated to protecting the citizens of Maryland by assuring transparent, lawful, and trustworthy elections. Our goal is to restore faith in our elections by identifying vulnerabilities in our election system, focusing on election integrity, voter integrity, voter accuracy, and voter validity. We work to hold the Board of Election Officials accountable to their affirmative duty to maintain accurate voter rolls. Our tireless efforts have yielded evidence which demands remedies including updating, fixing, and eliminating processes that created these vulnerabilities we have identified. Our goal is to hold the State Board of Elections accountable to remedying these vulnerabilities in the system in advance of the 2026 Primary and General Election.

The right of citizens to freely choose our representatives guarantees that our government upholds our will and serves by consent. Our life, liberty, and pursuit of happiness are secured by the law. Secure the Vote Maryland is particularly committed to ensuring fidelity to the law as it relates to elections and voting. Secure the Vote Maryland is ready to guard the validity of elections through public outreach, education, and litigation.

Did You Sign the Petition to urge Maryland General Assembly to enact meaningful reforms to safeguard our election process?

Read More
who we are
Our Secure the Vote team includes citizen volunteers working locally with Maryland Election Integrity LLC and nationally with United Sovereign Americans to ensure valid, accurate, and trustworthy voter rolls. Team members vary from data and legal experts to at-home moms and retired citizens.
We work with the local board of elections to assist in their oversight of the voter rolls. Clean voter rolls are required under the law for the voters to trust the election system. When we identify critical system irregularities, lack of controls, and voter data errors, the board of elections, by law, must remedy the concerns of the citizens.
Our team members also coordinate with the Maryland Voter Integrity Group and the Election Integrity Network (home of the Elections Bill of Rights).  The overall mission is ensure that election laws guarantee accuracy and reflect the will of the voters and that the elections are conducted in accordance with applicable law without favor to any party, candidate, voter or group of voters.

Poll Watcher

Unofficial observer of the election process. The elections “eyes and ears.”

Election Judge

Official paid temporary Election Day worker. Must complete a 3-hr training through the state.

Canvasser

Official paid, temporary Election worker who processes and counts the votes.

Closer

Reliable and consistent practices in voting and counting foster enduring trust in election results.
